movies.title: Abashiri Bangaichi
movies.plot: Shinichi is a good guy serving three years and approaching the end of his time. He escapes handcuffed to dangerous Gunda, who instigated the escape. Thus tethered, they start out on a journey across the desolate snow country of Hokkaido.
movies.simplePlot: Shinichi is a good guy serving three years and approaching the end of his time. He escapes handcuffed to dangerous Gunda, who instigated the escape. Thus tethered, they start out on a journey across the desolate snow country of Hokkaido.

biography.bio: Ken Takakura was a Japanese actor best known for his brooding style and the stoic, honorable presence he brought to his roles. Known as the "Clint Eastwood" of Japan, Takakura gained his streetwise swagger and tough guy persona watching yakuza turf battles over the lucrative black market and racketeering in postwar Fukuoka. This subject was covered in one of his most famous movies, Shôwa zankyô-den (1965) in which he played an honorable old-school yakuza among the violent post-war gurentai. A graduate of the prestigious Meiji University in Tokyo, Takakura happened by an audition in 1955 at the Toei Film Company, and decided to look in. Toei found a natural in Takakura as he debuted with Denkô karate uchi (1956) (Lightning Karate Blow) in 1956. As luck would have it, Japan experienced a boom in gangster films in the 1960s as the Japanese people struggled with the generational differences between those raised in pre-war and post-war Japan and these were Takakura's stock in trade. His breakout role came in 1965 playing a ex-con antihero in Abashiri Bangaichi (1965). By the time he left Toei in 1976, he had appeared in over 180 films. Takakura gained international recognition after starring in the 1975 Sydney Pollack sleeper hit Yakuza (1974) with Robert Mitchum and is probably best known in the West for his role in Ridley Scott's Black Rain (1989) in which he surprises American cops played by Michael Douglas and Andy Garcia by showing he can speak English. He again proved himself bankable to Western audiences in the 1992 Fred Schepisi comedy Mr. Baseball (1992) starring Tom Selleck. While he slowed down a bit in his older years, he remained active. His later films included Riding Alone for Thousands of Miles (2005), by Chinese director Yimou Zhang.
biography.name: Ken Takakura

biography.bio: Kôji Nanbara was born on June 7, 1927 in Yokohama, Kanagawa, Japan as Uwaji Itsui. He was an actor, known for Branded to Kill (1967), The Human Condition I: No Greater Love (1959) and The Bad Sleep Well (1960). He died on December 20, 2001 in Chofu, Tokyo, Japan.
biography.name: Kôji Nanbara

biography.bio: Tetsurô Tamba was born on July 17, 1922 in Tokyo, Japan as Shozaburo Tanba. He was an actor and writer, known for You Only Live Twice (1967), Harakiri (1962) and Le royaume des chats (2002). He died on September 24, 2006 in Tokyo.
biography.name: Tetsurô Tamba

biography.bio: Tôru Abe was born on March 28, 1917 in Fukuoka, Japan. He was an actor, known for Tokyo Story (1953), The Human Condition I: No Greater Love (1959) and Shogun (1980). He died on July 18, 1993.
biography.name: Tôru Abe

biography.bio: Kanjûrô Arashi was born on December 8, 1903 in Kyoto, Japan as Teruichi Takahashi. He was an actor, known for Zatoichi Meets Yojimbo (1970), Orenji Rôdo kyûkô (1978) and Emperor Meiji and the Great Russo-Japanese War (1958). He died on October 21, 1980 in Kyoto.
biography.name: Kanjûrô Arashi

biography.bio: Kunie Tanaka was born on November 23, 1932 in Gifu, Japan. He is an actor, known for Battles Without Honor and Humanity (1973), Sanjuro (1962) and La servante et le samouraï (2004).
biography.name: Kunie Tanaka

biography.bio: Kenji Ushio was born on March 23, 1925 in Tokyo, Japan. He was an actor, known for Kamen Raidâ tai jigoku taishi (1972), Akuma-Kun (1966) and Lone Wolf and Cub: Baby Cart in the Land of Demons (1973). He died in 1998.
biography.name: Kenji Ushio

biography.bio: Kôji Takishima is an actor, known for Abashiri Bangaichi (1965), Semi dokyumento: Monzetsu cabaret (1976) and Gangster Cop (1970).
biography.name: Kôji Takishima

biography.bio: Kôji Miemachi is an actor, known for Female Prisoner Scorpion: Jailhouse 41 (1972), White Snake Enchantment (1983) and Female Prisoner #701: Scorpion (1972).
biography.name: Kôji Miemachi

biography.bio: Kazu Sugiyoshi is an actor, known for Abashiri Bangaichi (1965).
biography.name: Kazu Sugiyoshi

biography.bio: Seiya Satô is an actor, known for La marche de Kamata (1982), Female Prisoner Scorpion: Beast Stable (1973) and Zenka onna: koroshi-bushi (1973).
biography.name: Seiya Satô

biography.bio: Jôji Yoshimura is an actor, known for Abashiri Bangaichi (1965), Abashiri bangaichi: Bôkyô hen (1965) and Abashiri bangaichi: Kettô reika 30 do (1967).
biography.name: Jôji Yoshimura

biography.bio: Kôji Sekiyama was born on May 22, 1929. He is an actor, known for Lone Wolf and Cub: Baby Cart in Peril (1972), A Fugitive from the Past (1965) and Gangster Cop (1970).
biography.name: Kôji Sekiyama

biography.bio: Tadashi Suganuma is an actor, known for Ana-ta-han (1953), A Fugitive from the Past (1965) and Abashiri Bangaichi (1965).
biography.name: Tadashi Suganuma

biography.bio: Tatsuya Kitayama is an actor, known for A Fugitive from the Past (1965), Gang tai Gang (1962) and Abashiri Bangaichi (1965).
biography.name: Tatsuya Kitayama
